headline: Multiple camps add variety but consume travel time
summary: Moving between camps provides ecosystem variety and avoids single-location fatigue. However, each move costs half a day of game viewing to transit and settle. For trips under 6 days, one or two camps is often better. For longer trips, 2-3 camps provides good variety without excessive transit. More than 3 camps rarely adds value.

assumptions.text: Each camp move typically costs half a day of game viewing time.
Different camps in different ecosystems provide genuine variety.
Staying in one place for 5+ nights can feel repetitive for some travelers.

losses: Less depth in any single area

change_conditions: If trip is under 6 days, stick to 1-2 camps.
If specific ecosystem variety is desired, plan camps accordingly.
If avoiding fatigue, 3 nights per camp is a good minimum.
If depth in one area matters, stay put and explore thoroughly.
